item.title: OLAP Piont
item.description:
distributed OLAP datastore
Online Analytical Processing
åœ¨çº¿åˆ†æå¤„ç†

Pinot is a real-time distributed OLAP datastore, built to deliver scalable real-time analytics with low latency. It can ingest from batch data sources (such as Hadoop HDFS, Amazon S3, Azure ADLS, Google Cloud Storage) as well as stream data sources (such as Apache Kafka).

Pinot was built by engineers at LinkedIn and Uber and is designed to scale up and out with no upper bound. Performance always remains constant based on the size of your cluster and an expected query per second (QPS) threshold.

item.title: Docker
item.description:
keyword: Docker

What is the difference between Docker Desktop for Linux and Docker Engine?

Docker Desktop å’Œ Docker Engine çš„åŒºåˆ«

Install docker for debian

Install using the apt repository 

# Add Docker's official GPG key:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install ca-certificates curl gnupg
sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/debian/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg
sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg

# Add the repository to Apt sources:
echo \
 "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/debian \
 $(. /etc/os-release && echo "$VERSION_CODENAME") stable" | \
 sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update

item.title: LLM, What's the Token?
item.description:
Token vs Word

Summary:

Summary OpenAi
What are tokens and how to count them? | OpenAI Help Center 

- 1 token ~= 4 chars in English
- 1 token ~= Â¾ words
- 100 tokens ~= 75 words
Or

- 1-2 sentence ~= 30 tokens
- 1 paragraph ~= 100 tokens
- 1,500 words ~= 2048 tokens

Why need Token?

item.title: jetlag
item.description:
Jet lag
Jet Lag | Travelers’ Health | CDC

Jet lag is caused by a mismatch between a personâ€™s normal daily rhythms and a new time zone. It is a temporary sleep problem that usually occurs when you travel across more than three time zones but can affect anyone who travels across multiple time zones. Jet lag can affect your mood, your ability to concentrate, and your physical and mental performance. Fortunately, you can take steps to minimize the effects of jet lag.

item.description:
Force update specify commit id


git filter-repo --commit-callback '
if commit.original_id == b"45131da3ef02aa324590ee29b4d7417686950297":
 commit.author_name = b"NewName"
 commit.author_email = b"NewName@gmail.com"
 commit.committer_name = b"NewName"
 commit.committer_email = b"NewName@gmail.com"
'

Force update specify Author


git filter-repo --force --commit-callback '
old_author_name = "Old"
old_author_email = "Old"
new_author_name = "New"
new_author_email = "New"

if commit.author_name == old_author_name and commit.author_email == old_author_email:
 commit.author_name = new_author_name
 commit.author_email = new_author_email

if commit.committer_name == old_author_name and commit.committer_email == old_author_email:
 commit.committer_name = new_author_name
 commit.committer_email = new_author_email
'

item.title: Gradle Dependcy Graph å¯è§†åŒ–
item.description:
build.gradle

...
 
apply from: 'depend.gradle'

...

depend.gradle

import groovy.json.JsonOutput 
 
 
class DependencyCounter { 
 static int count = 0 
 static String getCount() { 
 count++ 
 return "$count"; 
 } 
} 
// å®šä¹‰ä»»åŠ¡æ¥æ‰“å°æ‰€æœ‰æ¨¡å—çš„ä¾èµ–å¹¶ä¿å­˜ä¸ºJSONæ–‡ä»¶ 
task printAllModuleDependencies { 
 doLast { 
 def rootResult = [:] 
 rootResult["name"] = DependencyCounter.getCount() 
 rootResult["desc"] = "root" 
 def allProjectChildArr = [] 
 rootResult["children"] = allProjectChildArr 
 allprojects { project -> 
 var item = [:] 
// item["name"] = project.name 
 item["name"] = DependencyCounter.getCount() 
 item["desc"] = "printAllModuleDependencies:"+project.name 
// item["name"] = project.name 
 item["children"] = getOneProject(project) 
 allProjectChildArr << item 
 } 
 
 // å°†ä¾èµ–æ ‘å†™å…¥JSONæ–‡ä»¶ 
 def jsonOutput = JsonOutput.toJson(rootResult) 
// def outputFile = new File("$buildDir/dependencies.json") 
 def outputFile = new File("/Users/cocui/i100/github/EnglishProd/public/data/dependencies.json") 
 outputFile.text = JsonOutput.prettyPrint(jsonOutput) 
 
 println "Dependencies saved to ${outputFile.absolutePath}" 
 } 
} 
 
def getOneProject(project){ 
 def allChildArr = [] 
 project.configurations.each { config -> 
 var childrenArr= getOneConfig(config) 
 if (childrenArr != null && childrenArr.size() != 0) { 
 allChildArr << [ 
 "name": DependencyCounter.getCount(), 
 "desc": "getOneProject:"+config.name, 
 "children": childrenArr 
 ] 
 } 
 } 
 return allChildArr 
} 
 
def getOneConfig(config){ 
 def allChildArr = [] 
 def dependencies = [] 
 if (config.canBeResolved) { // ç¡®ä¿é…ç½®å¯è§£æ 
 if (config.name != "compileClasspath") { 
 return [] 
 } 
 def visited = new HashSet<String>() 
 def currentConfigurations = [:] 
 try { 
 dependencies = collectDependencies(config.resolvedConfiguration.firstLevelModuleDependencies, visited, 0) 
// projectDependencies[config.name] = dependencies 
// println("config.name: ${config.name}") 
//// currentConfigurations["name"] = config.name 
// currentConfigurations["name"] = DependencyCounter.getCount() 
// currentConfigurations["desc"] = "getOneConfig:"+config.name 
// currentConfigurations["children"] = dependencies 
 
 allChildArr << currentConfigurations 
 } catch (Exception e) { 
// projectDependencies[config.name] = [ 
// "error": "Failed to resolve dependencies", 
// "message": e.message 
// ] 
 } 
 } 
 return dependencies 
} 
// é€’å½’å‡½æ•°æ¥æ”¶é›†ä¾èµ–é¡¹ 
def collectDependencies(Set<ResolvedDependency> dependencies, Set<String> visited, int depth) { 
 def result = [] 
 
 if (depth > 2) { 
// result << ["dependency": "... (too deep, stopping recursion)"] 
 return result 
 } 
 
 dependencies.each { dep -> 
 def dependencyKey = "${dep.moduleGroup}:${dep.moduleName}:${dep.moduleVersion}" 
 if (!visited.contains(dependencyKey)) { 
 visited.add(dependencyKey) 
 try { 
 def children = collectDependencies(dep.children, visited, depth + 1) 
 result << ["name":DependencyCounter.getCount(),"desc": dependencyKey, "children": children] 
 } catch (Exception e) { 
 result << ["dependency": dependencyKey, "error": e.message] 
 } 
 } else { 
// result << ["dependency": dependencyKey, "note": "already visited"] 
 } 
 } 
 
 return result 
}
